intro: Hygrophila oblongifolia, commonly known as water hyssop, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly hairy and have a distinctive serrated edge. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple, arranged in spikes at the top of the stems. It thrives in moist or aquatic environments, making it a common species in marshes and along waterways. Hygrophila oblongifolia is often used in ornamental gardening and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
